Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders

Interface DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser

All Known Subinterfaces:
DefaultPersonInitialiser
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultModelBuilder
public interface DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser
Default initialiser for the phenomenological in‑host model.

This interface provides the default logic to construct an InHostPhenomenologicalState from a PhenomenologicalModel configuration and execution parameters. It samples the incubation and viral/immune peak timings and calibrates simple biphasic logistic models used to represent viral load and immune response.

Role in composition: this initialiser is composed into DefaultPersonInitialiser and DefaultModelBuilder. The DefaultModelBuilder delegates to this interface's default method to create a person's phenomenological in‑host state. Replacing the in‑host behaviour can be done by substituting this interface or by overriding the delegation point in a subclass of the model builder.

Demographic adjustment: where a PersonDemographic is supplied the configuration is adjusted with ReflectionUtils.modify(X, io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.PartialDemographicAdjustment, io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic) prior to sampling so that age or group specific scalings provided by DemographicAdjustment.Phenomenological are applied.

Extension guidance: keep this initialiser focused on creating the immutable in‑host state and avoid heavy IO; any expensive precomputation should be performed at outbreak baselining.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • initialiseInHostModel

      default InHostPhenomenologicalState initialiseInHostModel(PhenomenologicalModel configuration, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig, Optional<PersonDemographic> person, Sampler rng, int time)
      Create an InHostPhenomenologicalState from a phenomenological configuration.

      The default implementation samples incubation, time to peak and recovery delays, and calibrates the viral load and immune response models using InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic helper methods. Demographic adjustments are applied before sampling.

      Parameters:
      configuration - the phenomenological in‑host configuration
      execConfig - execution configuration providing contextual rates
      person - optional demographic used to apply demographic adjustments
      rng - sampler used to draw from distributions
      time - current simulation time used to timestamp the state
      Returns:
      an initial InHostPhenomenologicalState
